details: Numerous projects with different programming languages. One of which will be featured in the projects section.
Inverted classroom model: learning through videos and asking questions in 'class'
Project 1: A website for a fictional coffee company company with HTML, CSS and JS
Project 2: A fitness app with React, Tailwind CSS and Hygraph
Bachelor thesis on the topic of New Work. Comparing the concept of New Work within the company OTTO and the company Google portrayed in YouTube videos.
Working on different internal projects with primarily React
Working on different projects with primarily Vue.js and Nuxt 3
Opportunity to write New Work posts for the company

skills.name: TypeScript
skills.description: I regularly use TypeScript in both my job and academic work. It's also the language I chose for personal projects, including building this portfolio.

skills.name: Vue.js
skills.description: While working at GEPROG, I gained hands-on experience with Vue.js across several projects, building responsive user interfaces and deepening my understanding of this framework.

skills.name: Nuxt 3
skills.description: I worked with Nuxt 3 at GEPROG and also used it to build this portfolio. Additionally, I wrote a blog post exploring its features, which helped me refine my skills.

skills.name: React
skills.description: At OTTO, I am working on multiple projects with React, building components and user interfaces for web applications. This helped me improve my knowledge of React’s ecosystem and best practices.

skills.name: Tailwind CSS
skills.description: I used Tailwind CSS at both OpenCampus, GEPROG as well as my personal projects to create clean, responsive designs.

skills.name: Flutter
skills.description: As part of my studies, I used Flutter to build a mobile app that connected people with job opportunities nearby. This project helped me develop skills in mobile app development with a focus on cross-platform solutions.

skills.name: C++
skills.description: In my studies, I worked with C++ on a project where my team created a human benchmark game. This project allowed me to enhance my programming skills through practical applications and teamwork.

skills.name: Figma
skills.description: I’ve used Figma in both academic and work settings for designing user interfaces. It’s been especially useful for planning the layout of this portfolio and other projects.
